text:
- Magellan TV is a
documentary streaming service

that specializes in major
genres of history, science,
nature, space, adventure.

- We have thousands of hours
of long form factual content

that you can get on your
phone, on your Smart TV,
whoever it is that you stream.

- Our core mission is to
develop a relationship
with documentary lovers on a global scale.

However, most of our
programming is in English

and many of our viewers
don't speak English fluently.
So how do we reach them?
The traditional solution is dubbing,

but that's a time consuming,
costly labor intensive process.

One language, one dub, can
cost thousands of dollars.

- That is not something
that is approachable
for your average small to medium business.

So that's something that has
always been a major barrier
of entry for us.

- We've been working with
AWS for a number of years.
Mission Cloud is a partner of AWS
and their job is to enable us
to use AWS resources more effectively.

- So Mission asked, what is
the absolute moon for you guys?
What is your ultimate challenge
that you're facing right now?

And the ultimate
challenge realistically is
globalization of our content.
Mission introduced us to their engineers

and said essentially that
we could start building
this pipeline.

Now, fast forward to
this kind of nexus point
of generative AI developing,

especially within this last
year of AWS services evolving,
translate, transcribe, poly is incredible.
The fact that we can put voice to text.

All of these things
have essentially evolved

to the point where it is no
longer can we do this, it's how.
- This is a complex process.
It relies heavily on generative AI.
It has to replicate human translation
and capture elements like slang, idioms,
culturally sensitive phrases.

The Mission Cloud solution can
do all of this very quickly,
like within minutes,

and that changes the economics
of distribution, really.

- We were talking about
somewhere like $20 a minute

to get it dubbed into
a localized language.

Now we're looking at
less than $20 per hour.
- It's just bursting doors wide open.
We're innovating, we're building something
that the world doesn't have yet,

and a company that's as
small as Magellan TV,

that isn't something
we normally get to do.

So we're working with
AWS to build something
that will hopefully have a global impact.

And we'll make it so that
small businesses like ours

can have more of a global
presence, a global reach.
- We come from the ranks of filmmakers,

so our goal is to take
people to new places,
show it to them in a new way,
and make it accessible to them.

It's all about drawing
together a global community
of documentary lovers
who share our curiosity about the world
and our desire to explore and understand
and see what's out there.
